Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to climb down|to step down|to descend
Node.definition: = action by which human, animals, or deities move (voluntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon

= set of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth; ≈ associated with hardness
= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task
= flour made from ground grain kernels, ► used for baking bread, as ingredient for food, and as grain offering

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them
= gauze like covering; ► worn over the face, usually by women; ≈ associated with beauty
= causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object
exact meaning unknown, probably: = the part of a coat or dress that hangs below the waist

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them
= the upper part of the leg of humans and animals
= flowing body of water

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

Node.gloss: to meet|to reach|to find|to entreat|to pray|to intercede
Node.definition: = process by which humans meet other humans or reach an object while travelling from one location to another|= action by which humans address deities with humility and politeness, ► with the purpose of asking for a favor
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= state in which someone refrains from speaking

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign
= process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law
= causative action by which humans or deities bring dishonor on other humans
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community
literally: to make (someone's) yoke heavy; hence: = action by which human rules exercise authority on other with a heavy hand

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put in/to/on (one's) heart; hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= process by which humans are occupied with sensuous pleasure
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state of non existence of a person, place or event
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness
= state of having lost one's husband; ► required widow's clothing ≈ and was associated with disgrace
= a very short length of time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations
= state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ in a supernatural way
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
literally: to cause to turn; hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to pursue a wrong course of events

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state of non existence of a person, place or event
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
literally: to fall (upon someone); hence: = process by which humans are affected by a certain condition, emotion, or supernatural influence
= process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= causative action by which humans do what is needed to prevent a dreaded event from happening
literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ in a supernatural way
= action by which humans make an effort to gain control over humans, animals, or deities ◄ through rituals and incantations
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood

Node.gloss: perhaps|maybe|what if|suppose ...|in the unlikely event that ...
Node.definition: = marker indicating that the information that follows is possibly true but that there is no complete certainty

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= process by which someone's well being is promoted by a certain action or event

Node.gloss: perhaps|maybe|what if|suppose ...|in the unlikely event that ...
Node.definition: = marker indicating that the information that follows is possibly true but that there is no complete certainty
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= action by which humans divide up a given object in their minds for purposes of research

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well

= celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= carbonized material resulting from heating wood, ► and used for cooking or warming; ≈ used figuratively to denote one's posterity
= action by which humans cause themselves to feel warm or hot
= fire; ► used for burning sacrifices and other objects, setting fire to arrows, and warming oneself; ≈ associated with light, warmth, and destruction
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= a person who goes around with merchandies or wares to sell and/or trade
= the period of a person's life between childhood and adulthood

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
